comments:
I tried to create a new Task in my JIRA repository with Mylyn + JIRA connector. First I got a  message "could not create ticket". I couldn't find anything on the internet about this error message, so I tried to change the JIRA connector configuration, enabling HTTP authentication - just for a try. But then I got this null pointer exception.

-- Error Log --
Date: Fri Sep 14 12:42:49 CEST 2007
Message: no message
Severity: Error
Plugin ID: org.eclipse.mylyn
Stack Trace:
java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.jira.core.service.web.JiraWebIssueService$9.execute(JiraWebIssueService.java:553)
at org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.jira.core.service.web.JiraWebSession.doInSession(JiraWebSession.java:56)
at org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.jira.core.service.web.JiraWebIssueService.createIssue(JiraWebIssueService.java:543)
at org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.jira.core.service.soap.JiraRpcClient.createIssue(JiraRpcClient.java:282)
at org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.jira.ui.JiraTaskDataHandler.postTaskData(JiraTaskDataHandler.java:525)
at org.eclipse.mylyn.tasks.ui.editors.AbstractRepositoryTaskEditor$37.run(AbstractRepositoryTaskEditor.java:2754)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)

The error above is most likely caused by missing attributes which was fixed recently. As a work-around please  select "Update attributes" from the context menu of the repository in the repositories view. 

Could you try the latest dev build available here and report back if issue creation still fails?

 http://www.eclipse.org/mylyn/downloads/builds.php

(In reply to comment #1)
> The error above is most likely caused by missing attributes which was fixed
> recently. As a work-around please  select "Update attributes" from the context
> menu of the repository in the repositories view. 
> Could you try the latest dev build available here and report back if issue
> creation still fails?
>  http://www.eclipse.org/mylyn/downloads/builds.php

OK, I have performed the "update attributes" and I didn't get any stack trace this time. But, I still get the "Could not create ticket" message. I guess that's because we have custom (mandatory) attributes in our JIRA. I read something about that on the Eclipsepedia  http://wiki.eclipse.org/Mylyn_Jira_Connector
Steffen: do you know our current support (or lack thereof) for custom/mandatory attributes?
Thomas, could you give an example of a custom attribute that needs to be specified during issue creation? Are those attributes displayed in the Mylyn task editor?

Created an attachment (id=80737)
Screen shot of new of new issue in eclipse

This screen shot shows how the dialog looks when I create a new of new issue in eclipse. Custom attributes are not shown. Some of the custom attributes are also mandatory.
Compare this to the other screen shot of how the creat dialog looks when I create a new issue in the browser.

Created an attachment (id=80738)
Screen shot of new issue in browser

This screen shot shows how the dialog looks when I create a new of new issue in a browser. You can see some custom attributes. Some of the custom attributes are also mandatory.
Compare this to the other screen shot of how the create dialog looks when I create a new issue in eclipse.

Thanks Thomas. It seems that Mylyn parses information about custom fields from the RSS which does not work for creating new issues. The JiraSoapService offers a getCustomFields() method that should be in that case. I'll investigate that for the next release if time permits.

Steffen, getCustomFields() call offers much less information about custom fields that is available in RSS. Basically it only give field ids. We either have to cache information about fields collected from issues or rpc api need to be extended to provide complete information about field names, types and available options. The latter also not available in the rss feed. See current limitations section for jira connector on the wiki.
Okay, we'll need to file a feature request against JIRA to improve the customs field support in the SOAP API.
